definition: Bruges (Dutch Brugge), medieval town in Belgium
cloth/to declare/to announce/to spread/to make known
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]
abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

sentences.english: I lived in youth hostel in all my touring destinations in Europe except Brugge.
sentences.chinese: 在歐洲的旅行中除了布魯日之外都是住的青旅。

sentences.english: The earliest stock exchanges emerge in Bruges and Italy in the thirteenth century.
sentences.chinese: 十三世紀，最早的股票交易所出現於布魯日與意大利。

sentences.english: The College of Europe, the main incubator of future servants for the different European Union institutions, is situated here.
sentences.chinese: 爲歐盟培養未來官員的歐洲學院也坐落在布魯日。

sentences.english: We could go up to Bruges, or to the Ardennes.
sentences.chinese: 我們可以朝北到布魯日或者阿登森林去嘛。

sentences.english: A city of northwest Belgium on the North Sea west-southwest of Bruges.
sentences.chinese: 比利時西北城市，位於布魯日西南偏西，瀕臨北海。

sentences.english: Arnolfini was a member of a merchant family from Lucca living in Bruges .
sentences.chinese: 阿爾諾菲尼是居住在比利時布魯日的意大利盧卡商人。

sentences.english: We want to win although it won't be easy against Brugge.
sentences.chinese: 儘管與布魯日的比賽很艱難，但是我們希望贏得比賽。

definition: La Coruña or A Coruña (city in Galicia, Spain)
Super Cup (various sports)/Super Bowl (American football championship game)

pinyin: Ma3 si1 te4 li3 he4 te4

definition: Rostov-on-Don, Russian river port and regional capital close to Sea of Azov (north of the Black Sea)
FC Internazionale Milano (football club)/abbr. for 國際米蘭足球俱樂部|国际米兰足球俱乐部[Guo2 ji4 Mi3 lan2 Zu2 qiu2 Ju4 le4 bu4]
